channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus live updates: One new COVID-19 case in Victoria as state embarks on major testing blitz

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The market’s response to its first taste of the sector’s reality was to push bank shares down precipitously.
item.title: NAB reveals painful new normal as it rips off the dividend bandaid

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The Prime Minister returned to Downing Street after a three-week battle with coronavirus that culminated in his admission to an intensive care unit.
item.title: 'A new wave of death and disease': Johnson returns to work with stark warning for British public

item.description: A Queensland man who allegedly shot his business partner in the head more than two decades ago will be tried for murder without a jury.
item.title: Judge-only trial for Queensland murder accused

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Victoria Police and the prosecutors have given the all-clear for the royal commission findings into George Pell to be published.
item.title: No legal impediment to release of Pell report, says Victorian Attorney-General

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: It is understandable that the AFL is looking to an extreme device to get footballers back on to the field, and our TV screens. But is it fair?
item.title: AFL planning hubs - or are they cages?

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe app goes live as global COVID-19 cases near 3 million, Australian death toll stands at 83

item.dc:creator: Larissa Ham
item.description: Victorian parents are divided on the issue of sending children back to school, even as classrooms open up and coronavirus restrictions begin to ease in other states.
item.title: Victorian parents divided on return to school

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: The government insists schools are safe, but wants families to continue remote learning until May 11 when students will return to class for one day per week.
item.title: Principals fear student influx when school resumes this week

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Top jockey Ben Melham is charged with betting more than $21,000 - including $14,000 in one day - by Racing Victoria stewards
item.title: Top jockey Melham faces multiple gambling charges

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Rugby Australia's interim executive chairman moved to cool outgoing Ten boss Paul Anderson on a day in which NZ revealed plans to review Super Rugby in its entirety.
item.title: McLean moves to cool Ten boss as NZ announce review of Super Rugby

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Karen Paxman has long expected that a career as an AFLW star and work with the Police Association would throw up emotional highs and lows but this past week has been extreme.
item.title: Paxman earns AFLW honour in the midst of tragedy

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Kevin King's family knew he was destined to be a police officer long before he entered the force, and once he joined it became his home away from home.
item.title: 'Our hearts are so broken': Family of fallen police officer Kevin King mourns loss of 'big softie'

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The business has called on the public to help fight its removal from its prime spot near the Opera House after inhabiting the brown-brick building since 1988.
item.title: Iconic eatery Sydney Cove Oyster Bar to lose harbourside location

item.description: Shoppers largely stayed away as the Emporium shopping centre reopened its doors in the CBD on Monday, despite indications an end to the lockdown was on the horizon.
item.title: Customers thin on the ground as Emporium reopens

item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern is optimistic New Zealand can "continue on a path of success".
item.title: 'We have achieved our goal': New Zealand 'eliminates' COVID-19 in the community

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Sharni Layton has capped off a huge season of improvement, earning AFLW All-Australian selection, and says the women's competition is here to stay.
item.title: All-Australian ruck Sharni Layton says AFLW is 'here to stay'

item.description: The supermarket giants believe the COVIDSafe app will help create a safer workplace.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: After rushing through Easter to train teachers in online teaching, TAFE NSW says it has moved 61 per cent of course content online.
item.title: TAFE moves courses online for start of new term

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk is warning restrictions being lifted on Friday night can be tightened again if there is a rise in coronavirus cases.
item.title: Queenslanders warned not to cause new wave of virus cases

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Every person granted access to AFL hubs will have to be tested upon entry and then several times a week under rigorous protocols being fleshed out by league bosses and health experts.
item.title: AFL to turn testing times into hub measure

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: St Mary’s Primary in St Kilda East has made an artwork in tribute to four police officers who died when they were hit by a truck on the Eastern Freeway.
item.title: 'Art connects us': School mural honours fallen police officers

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: In China, babies have been taken away from mothers to protect them from coronavirus. But in Australia, things have been done differently.
item.title: The birth of a coronavirus carrier's baby in Australia was different, for all the right reasons

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The NSW government could reconsider timing and priority of long-term infrastructure plans in wake of the pandemic.
item.title: NSW Transport boss flags potential shake-up of Sydney infrastructure plans

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Agencies need to modernise and take advantage of technology that allows them to operate at night.
item.title: 'Fundamental change' needed in fire preparation and response: Lapsley

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: While the dictator's absence indicates has not been working as normally, suggestions are growing he is being isolated from the coronavirus.
item.title: South Korea insists Kim Jong-un is ‘alive and well’

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Australian house prices could tumble by a cumulative 30 per cent over this year and next under the most pessimistic scenario unveiled by National Australia Bank.
item.title: House prices could dive 30 per cent in 'severe downside' scenario

item.description: A string of city and provincial-based stables head to the "Grange" with two, three and four-year-old charges.
item.title: Stables send new talent to old testing ground at Kembla

item.description: Racing is back in the Gong on Tuesday with a seven-race card at Kembla Grange.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Kembla Grange on Tuesday

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: The big banks didn't pass on rate cuts because they wanted more money while loyal mortgage-holders are getting dudded, the competition watchdog says.
item.title: Banks didn't pass on rate cuts because they wanted more money: ACCC

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: state moves to ease COVID-19 restrictions but no changes to rules on schools

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Ben Melham is facing a string of charges for allegedly facilitating tens of thousands of dollars in bets during a six-month period last year.
item.title: Top jockey charged by stewards after allegedly betting through partner's account

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Sydney superstar Lance Franklin could be playing in the Swans' next AFL match, as he continues his rehabilitation after knee surgery.
item.title: Franklin finds 'silver lining' in AFL holding pattern

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Online learning during the coronavirus crisis could squander weeks of education for Australian children, with the students in greatest need facing the most risk of harm, new studies show.
item.title: Students at risk of losing weeks of learning from going online

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Former digital transformation public servant Professor Lesley Seebeck won't download the coronavirus tracing app because of the government's track record on data.
item.title: Former top public servant: I won't download the coronavirus app

item.description: The latest episode of our markets podcast discusses a less-than-impressive US reporting season and what early access to super means for the local market.
item.title: The Short Squeeze: Will early super withdrawals weigh on the ASX?

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The two NRL stars found themselves in hot water after posting photos on social media of a camping trip on the North Coast.
item.title: Addo-Carr, Mitchell fined for camping gaffe as V'landys talks tough

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: European racing remains shut down, which means many owners and trainers are anxious to offload good horses - giving Australian syndicators a buying opportunity.
item.title: Galloper market swings in favour of Australian buyers

item.dc:creator: Lisa Davies
item.description: The coronavirus appears to be tearing at the fabric cocooning many of our society’s institutions, structures and civic functions.
item.title: The ties that bind us can pull tight or unravel

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Major footwear retailer Accent Group will shut some of its 522 stores and shift major parts of its business online after digital sales took off during the COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: Hype DC, Platypus owner to shut stores after big leap in online sales

item.description: From facilities to weather, Brisbane chief executive Greg Swann is telling the AFL there's no place like Queensland.
item.title: Queensland AFL hub makes sense: Lions CEO

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Australian technology leaders say local startups will need help to recruit fresh talent once the coronavirus pandemic is over.
item.title: Technology jobs on the chopping block as startups tighten belts

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: A May 28 return has moved another step closer after the NRL was successful in its application for an exemption to allow the Warriors into the country.
item.title: NZ Warriors granted federal exemption to enter Australia

item.dc:creator: Lisa Davies
item.description: So where to from here? How do we get our lives and economy out of hibernation before it’s too late, without compromising the nation’s health?
item.title: The coronavirus crisis: Where to from here?

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: An armed robber has taken off with the contents of a safe after holding-up a seventh floor gold buyers business in Melbourne's CBD.
item.title: Gunpoint gold heist: Bandit in surgical mask robs Collins St gold dealer

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The star Wallabies playmaker is reportedly weighing up an offer from the English Premiership club.
item.title: To'omua leaves door open for Bath as players weigh up overseas offers

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: As other states begin to ease some social distancing rules, NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has resisted calls to loosen restrictions beyond its plans for a staged return to schools.
item.title: Sydney beaches to reopen as NSW records just two new COVID-19 cases

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The former treasurer has thrown his support behind the early access to super policy, noting properly managed funds should have no trouble paying out members.
item.title: 'Might not make it to retirement:' Costello backs early access to super

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Dozens of patients at a Melbourne psychiatric clinic at the centre of a coronavirus outbreak will be transferred to The Alfred hospital after authorities temporarily closed the facility.
item.title: Psychiatric clinic shut and patients moved to The Alfred following COVID-19 outbreak
